title: 103_hr3591
content: The "Social Security Retirement Age Reform Act of 1993" establishes a phased-in 5-year increase in the age for eligibility for OASDI benefits by the year 2030. This includes changes to the normal retirement age and early retirement age as defined in the Social Security Act. The "Social Security Retirement Age Reform Act of 1993" sets the normal retirement age at 65 for those reaching the reference age before 2000, 65 plus an age increase factor for those reaching the reference age between 2000 and 2030, and 70 for those reaching the reference age after 2030. Early retirement age is 3 years less than normal retirement age. The "Social Security Retirement Age Reform Act of 1993" establishes the reference age as 62 for old-age benefits and 60 for widow's benefits. The age increase factor is calculated based on the number of months between January 2000 and the year the individual reaches the reference age. Additional amendments redesignate retirement age as normal retirement age in various sections of the Act. The "Social Security Retirement Age Reform Act of 1993" changes retirement age to normal retirement age in various sections of the Act, with age 62 designated as early retirement age. The "Social Security Retirement Age Reform Act of 1993" amends multiple sections of the Act by replacing "age 62" with "early retirement age (as defined in section 216(l)(2))." The "Social Security Retirement Age Reform Act of 1993" replaces specific age requirements with terms related to normal retirement age in different sections of the Act.
